trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics: Rotate log-in credentials for inputs and outputs | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics: Rotate log-in credentials for inputs and outputs | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to update the credentials for Stream Analytics inputs and outputs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to update the credentials for Stream Analytics inputs and outputs.

trans-unit.source: Azure Stream Analytics today doesn’t allow replacing the credentials on an input/output while the job is running.
trans-unit.target: Azure Stream Analytics today doesn’t allow replacing the credentials on an input/output while the job is running.

trans-unit.source: While Azure Stream Analytics does support resuming a job from last output, we wanted to share the entire process for minimizing the lag between the stopping and starting of the job.
trans-unit.target: While Azure Stream Analytics does support resuming a job from last output, we wanted to share the entire process for minimizing the lag between the stopping and starting of the job.

trans-unit.source: Part 1 - Prepare the new set of credentials:
trans-unit.target: Part 1 - Prepare the new set of credentials:

trans-unit.source: This part is applicable to the following inputs/outputs:
trans-unit.target: This part is applicable to the following inputs/outputs:

trans-unit.source: For other inputs/outputs, proceed with Part 2.
trans-unit.target: For other inputs/outputs, proceed with Part 2.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Storage extention on the Azure Management Portal:
trans-unit.target: Go to the Storage extention on the Azure Management Portal:

trans-unit.source: Locate the storage used by your job and go into it:
trans-unit.target: Locate the storage used by your job and go into it:

trans-unit.source: Click the Manage Access Keys command:
trans-unit.target: Click the Manage Access Keys command:

trans-unit.source: Between the Primary Access Key and the Secondary Access Key, **pick the one not used by your job**.
trans-unit.target: Between the Primary Access Key and the Secondary Access Key, **pick the one not used by your job**.

trans-unit.source: Go to the Service Bus extension on the Azure Management Portal:
trans-unit.target: Go to the Service Bus extension on the Azure Management Portal:

trans-unit.source: Locate the Service Bus Namespace used by your job and go into it:
trans-unit.target: Locate the Service Bus Namespace used by your job and go into it:

trans-unit.source: If your job uses a shared access policy on the Service Bus Namespace, jump to step 6
trans-unit.target: If your job uses a shared access policy on the Service Bus Namespace, jump to step 6

trans-unit.source: Go to the Event Hubs tab:
trans-unit.target: Go to the Event Hubs tab:

trans-unit.source: Locate the Event Hub used by your job and go into it:
trans-unit.target: Locate the Event Hub used by your job and go into it:

trans-unit.source: On the Policy Name drop-down, locate the shared access policy used by your job:
trans-unit.target: On the Policy Name drop-down, locate the shared access policy used by your job:

trans-unit.source: Between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key, **pick the one not used by your job**.
trans-unit.target: Between the Primary Key and the Secondary Key, **pick the one not used by your job**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Note: you will need to connect to the SQL Databse Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Note: you will need to connect to the SQL Databse Service.

trans-unit.source: We are going to show how to do this using the management experience on the Azure Management Portal but you may choose to use some client-side tool such as SQL Server Management Studio as well.
trans-unit.target: We are going to show how to do this using the management experience on the Azure Management Portal but you may choose to use some client-side tool such as SQL Server Management Studio as well.

trans-unit.source: Go to the SQL Databases extension on the Azure Management Portal:
trans-unit.target: Go to the SQL Databases extension on the Azure Management Portal:

trans-unit.source: Locate the SQL Database used by your job and **click on the server** link on the same line:
trans-unit.target: Locate the SQL Database used by your job and **click on the server** link on the same line:

trans-unit.source: Type in your User Name, Password and click Log on:
trans-unit.target: Type in your User Name, Password and click Log on:

trans-unit.source: Type in the following query replacing <login_name> with your User Name and replacing
trans-unit.target: Type in the following query replacing <login_name> with your User Name and replacing

trans-unit.source: Go back to step 2 and this time click the database:
trans-unit.target: Go back to step 2 and this time click the database:

trans-unit.source: type in your User Name, Password, and click Log on:
trans-unit.target: type in your User Name, Password, and click Log on:

trans-unit.source: Type in the following query replacing <user_name> with a name by which you want to identify this login in the context of this database (you can provide the same value you gave for <login_name>, for example) and replacing <login_name> with your new user name:
trans-unit.target: Type in the following query replacing <user_name> with a name by which you want to identify this login in the context of this database (you can provide the same value you gave for <login_name>, for example) and replacing <login_name> with your new user name:

trans-unit.source: You should now provide your new user with the same roles and privledges your original user had.
trans-unit.target: You should now provide your new user with the same roles and privledges your original user had.

trans-unit.source: Part 2: Stopping the Stream Analytics Job
trans-unit.target: Part 2: Stopping the Stream Analytics Job

trans-unit.source: Go to the Stream Analytics extension on the Azure Management Portal:
trans-unit.target: Go to the Stream Analytics extension on the Azure Management Portal:

trans-unit.source: Locate your job and go into it:
trans-unit.target: Locate your job and go into it:

trans-unit.source: Go to the Inputs tab or the Outputs tab based on whether you are rotating the credentials on an Input or on an Output.
trans-unit.target: Go to the Inputs tab or the Outputs tab based on whether you are rotating the credentials on an Input or on an Output.

trans-unit.source: Click the Stop command and confirm the job has stopped:
trans-unit.target: Click the Stop command and confirm the job has stopped:

trans-unit.source: Wait for the job to stop.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the job to stop.

trans-unit.source: Locate the input/output you want to rotate credentials on and go into it:
trans-unit.target: Locate the input/output you want to rotate credentials on and go into it:

trans-unit.source: Part 3: Editing the credentials on the Stream Analytics Job
trans-unit.target: Part 3: Editing the credentials on the Stream Analytics Job

trans-unit.source: Find the Storage Account Key field and paste your newly generated key into it:
trans-unit.target: Find the Storage Account Key field and paste your newly generated key into it:

trans-unit.source: Click the Save command and confirm saving your changes:
trans-unit.target: Click the Save command and confirm saving your changes:

trans-unit.source: A connection test will automatically start when you save your changes, make sure that is has successfully passed.
trans-unit.target: A connection test will automatically start when you save your changes, make sure that is has successfully passed.

trans-unit.source: Find the Event Hub Policy Key field and paste your newly generated key into it:
trans-unit.target: Find the Event Hub Policy Key field and paste your newly generated key into it:

trans-unit.source: Click the Save command and confirm saving your changes:
trans-unit.target: Click the Save command and confirm saving your changes:

trans-unit.source: A connection test will automatically start when you save your changes, make sure that it has successfully passed.
trans-unit.target: A connection test will automatically start when you save your changes, make sure that it has successfully passed.

trans-unit.source: You will get the following confirmation:
trans-unit.target: You will get the following confirmation:

trans-unit.source: Click the Save command and confirm saving your changes:
trans-unit.target: Click the Save command and confirm saving your changes:

trans-unit.source: A connection test will automatically start when you save your changes, make sure it has successfully passed.
trans-unit.target: A connection test will automatically start when you save your changes, make sure it has successfully passed.

trans-unit.source: Find the User Name and Password fields and paste your newly created set of credentials into them:
trans-unit.target: Find the User Name and Password fields and paste your newly created set of credentials into them:

trans-unit.source: Click the Save command and confirm saving your changes:
trans-unit.target: Click the Save command and confirm saving your changes:

trans-unit.source: A connection test will automatically start when you save your changes, make sure that it has successfully passed.
trans-unit.target: A connection test will automatically start when you save your changes, make sure that it has successfully passed.

trans-unit.source: Part 4: Starting your job from last stopped time
trans-unit.target: Part 4: Starting your job from last stopped time

trans-unit.source: Pick the Last Stopped Time and click OK:
trans-unit.target: Pick the Last Stopped Time and click OK:

trans-unit.source: Part 5: Removing the old set of credentials
trans-unit.target: Part 5: Removing the old set of credentials

trans-unit.source: This part is applicable to the following inputs/outputs:
trans-unit.target: This part is applicable to the following inputs/outputs:

trans-unit.source: Repeat Part 1 for the Access Key that was previously used by your job to renew the now unused Access Key.
trans-unit.target: Repeat Part 1 for the Access Key that was previously used by your job to renew the now unused Access Key.

trans-unit.source: Repeat Part 1 for the Key that was previously used by your job to renew the now unused Key.
trans-unit.target: Repeat Part 1 for the Key that was previously used by your job to renew the now unused Key.

trans-unit.source: Go back to the query window from Part 1 Step 7 and type in the following query, replacing <previous_login_name> with the User Name that was previously used by your job:
trans-unit.target: Go back to the query window from Part 1 Step 7 and type in the following query, replacing <previous_login_name> with the User Name that was previously used by your job:

trans-unit.source: You should get the following confirmation:
trans-unit.target: You should get the following confirmation:

trans-unit.target: For further assistance, try our [Azure Stream Analytics forum](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/home?forum=AzureStreamAnalytics)
